Crime_Name: Discrimination complaint under the Canadian Human Rights Act
Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness in the dismissal of a discrimination complaint
Evidence_Assessment: Substantial evidence summaries provided; not all requested documents disclosed
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate lack of procedural fairness
Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires neutral and thorough investigation, opportunity to respond, and no reasonable apprehension of bias
Procedural_Issue: Adequacy of disclosure, potential bias of investigator
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged racial discrimination and unfair investigative process
Outcome_on_Merits: No violation of procedural fairness found
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Investigator was independent and experienced; applicant had opportunity to respond
Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence summaries, investigator's background, disclosure practices
Applicant_Challenge: Lack of procedural fairness in investigation
Defendant_Response: Commission conducted fair and impartial investigation
Legal_Provision: Sections of the Canadian Human Rights Act relating to complaints and investigations
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court
